description: Sea Surface Temperatures (SSTs) are restored to model climatology plus negative PDV anomaly by Newtonian cooling over the Pacific (10S-65N). The restoring timescale is 10 days for a 50m deep mixed layer (or equivalent). The restoring coefficient of 40 W/m2/K should decrease to zero over an 8 degree buffer zone bounding the restored region.  No restoring if sea ice is present. Idealised AMV anomalies of SST will be provided by DCPP.
name: RestoreSSTPDVnegPacific
rationale: To investigate the climate impacts of negative Pacific Decadal Variability (AMV) anomalies.
longName: Restore Pacific sea surface temperature to negative PDV
keywords: DCPP, SST, restored, PDV-, negative PDV, negative Pacific Decadal Variability
